title: Nord and Bert Couldn't Make Head or Tail of It

child.title: About PRIZM Invisiclues
child.content:
The PRIZM project (Pretty Reliable Invisiclues for Z-Machine) resulted from a collaboration between Digby McWiggle (digby_mcwiggle@hotmail.com) and Steven Marsh (marsh@netally.com, www.waitingforgo.com), with the aim of making the genuine Infocom invisiclues available as Z-Code computer files. The project was endorsed by Activision, who now hold the copyright for Infocom's material.

Whenever possible we have stayed faithful to the original printed Invisiclues booklets. Where both in-game and printed versions were available we have used the printed clues, as these were generally more detailed. Printing errors have been corrected whenever possible. The files have been formatted to display correctly on any screen with a width of at least 80 characters.

The home of the PRIZM project is www.waitingforgo.com. There you can download different versions of the files, with or without sample transcripts and missing documentation, and grouped by various classifications (unfortunately, limitations within the Z-Machine prevent all the invisiclues being packaged into one big file).

child.title: Credits
child.content:
Compiled, edited, and z-coded by:

Digby McWiggle (digby_mcwiggle@hotmail.com)

Steven Marsh (marsh@netally.com, www.waitingforgo.com)

from material supplied by:

Graeme Cree

Thanks also to:

Brian Hall

L. Ross Raszewski

Graham Nelson.

All material Copyright 1993, 1999 Activision, Inc. Used with permission.

This file Copyright 1999 Digby McWiggle & Steven Marsh.

Nord and Bert Couldn't Make Head or Tail of It and all other game names are registered trade marks of Activision.

child.title: Gorilla Warfare
hints: What do primates like to eat?

child.title: The Moose
hints: You must whip it, chill it out.

child.title: 22 over 7
hints: A famous fraction, a real ratio.
It's called pi. So type, PIE

child.title: Cereal Murderer
hints: How do you kill a vampire?
In the Meets Aisle is a steak.
GIVE THE MINTS TO THE VAMPIRE

child.title: Principals
hints: Why would THEY be playing hooky?

child.title: Returning Emily
hints: Bratwurst is on no shopping list.

child.title: Bear Clause
hints: Should you give a bear a hand?

child.title: Wall of Quartz
hints: Not so tough, just a half pint.

child.title: Locks
hints: The key to this one is a bit fishy.

child.title: Tacks
hints: The govt. really sticks it to you.

child.title: Mussels
hints: You may need to build a better body.

child.title: Buy an Item
hints: First, in the Cellar type SELLER
Also, have a cent and tax.

child.title: Traits
hints: What is the Jack of all Traits?
It depends on how you use it.
Don't let it out of your sight!

child.title: Cottony Fur
hints: Is it a pet peeve of yours?

child.title: Coldness
hints: Examine the jack of all traits.

child.title: On Frozen Pond
hints: How can you best break the ice?

child.title: The Mermaid
hints: After she's warmed, PULL THE PLUG.

child.title: An Old Dog
hints: The old boy's got a lot to learn
TEACH THE OLD DOG NEW TRICKS

child.title: Sow's Ear
hints: First, FIND A NEEDLE IN A HAYSTACK
TURN SOW'S EAR INTO A SILK PURSE

child.title: Mt. Molehill
hints: You have the power of creation.
MAKE A MOUNTAIN OUT OF A MOLEHILL

child.title: The Birds
hints: TAKE THE STONE FROM THE DOG
KILL TWO BIRDS WITH ONE STONE

child.title: The Wrong Tree
hints: What variety of spruce is it?
You're barking up the wrong tree!

child.title: Swords
hints: If you only had a hammer...

child.title: Horse and Cart
hints: LOOK THE GIFT HORSE IN THE MOUTH
PUT THE CART BEFORE THE HORSE

child.title: Peppers
hints: PICK A PECK OF PICKLED PEPPERS

child.title: Pig 4 Sale
hints: First, get the penny from purse.
An old word for bag is poke.
BUY A PIG IN A POKE. TAKE BAG
Go to the barn holding the bag.
Now, LET THE CAT OUT OF THE BAG

child.title: Donkey
hints: First find the tail and needle.
PIN THE TAIL ON THE DONKEY

child.title: The Milk
hints: The old dog will first spill it.

child.title: Grindstone
hints: PUT MY NOSE TO THE GRINDSTONE

child.title: Side of Barn
hints: HIT THE BROAD SIDE OF THE BARN

child.title: Eyes Have It
hints: LOOK AT WAITRESS WITH JAUNDICED EYE
GIVE THE WAITRESS AN EVIL EYE

child.title: Mickey Spleen
hints: You need to air out some anger.
VENT MY SPLEEN UPON THE WAITRESS

child.title: Your Table
hints: TURN THE TABLES ON THE WAITRESS

child.title: The Shadows
hints: Shadows are also known as umbrage.

child.title: Lion's Share
hints: What's a group of lions called?

child.title: Headband
hints: Examine it.  Made of wool, eh?
PULL THE WOOL OVER HER EYES

child.title: Dander
hints: This point should surely be raised.

child.title: Woodchip
hints: Okay, now just knock it off.
KNOCK THE CHIP OFF HER SHOULDER

child.title: A Fortune
hints: Now how should you take the advice?
TAKE ADVICE WITH A GRAIN OF SALT

child.title: Neon Sign
hints: In order to take the sign.

child.title: Desserts
hints: You could make them the waitress's.

child.title: Olive Tree
hints: OFFER AN OLIVE BRANCH TO WAITRESS

child.title: The Coals
hints: The waitress could use a rake-over

child.title: Ceiling
hints: There's no ceiling on your anger.

child.title: The Carpet
hints: CALL THE WAITRESS ONTO THE CARPET

child.title: Blood Caper
hints: WIPE UP THE BLOOD WITH THE CAPE

child.title: Pet Peeves
hints: They are both the cook's very own.
GET THE COOK'S GOAT. COOK HIS GOOSE

child.title: Can Can
hints: MAKE A LAUGHING STOCK OUT OF COOK

child.title: Frying Pan
hints: Try going from bad to worse?
JUMP FROM FRYING PAN INTO THE FIRE

child.title: Own Devices
hints: Might be hoisted on his own petard?
LEAVE THE COOK TO HIS OWN DEVICES

child.title: Ox-idental
hints: All depends on whose ox is gored.

child.title: Front Bottle
hints: Rather a bottle in front of me...
With the knife, GIVE BOB A LOBOTOMY

child.title: Water Bottle
hints: PUT BOTTLE UNDER THE SEAT CUSHION

child.title: Your Kazoo
hints: No such kazoo is to be found.

child.title: Cord Gloves
hints: WEAR GLOVES THEN PICK UP THE WIRE

child.title: The Fly
hints: What's it doing in Bob's soup?

child.title: Lamp Shade
hints: Are you just after cheap laughs?
Of course! WEAR THE LAMP SHADE

child.title: Match Stick
hints: LOOK AT BOB - give you a hot idea?
PUT THE MATCH IN BOB'S SHOE

child.title: The Sponge
hints: There's more than one sponge here.
Refer to Bob as a sponge.

child.title: Old bottle
hints: Find it in the medicine cabinet.
PUT THE BOTTLE ON THE MANTEL
When the Interior asks what you ....

child.title: Kremlin
hints: First, find the clock and the box.
Wind the clock. Put it in the box.

child.title: The Safe
hints: You don't have a leg to stand on.
Try a chair (see Old Bottle hint).
Any kind of key will fit the lock.
UNLOCK THE SAFE WITH THE CLOCK KEY

child.title: The Chain Mail
hints: Perhaps it's really a chain letter.

child.title: Revolution
hints: You say you have a rev-o-lu-tion.
Something needs to be set right.
In the Attic, REVOLVE THE ATTIC

child.title: The Lead House
hints: This'll be a real head scratcher.

child.title: The Gritty Pearl
hints: A gritty pearl is like a melody.

child.title: A Pan of Keys
hints: It's not jolly, round or green.

child.title: Child Goose Waist
hints: It's a LITTLE goose, a child.
GO ON A WILD GOOSE CHASE

child.title: On The Rocks
hints: Give the peas to the rocks.

child.title: Rat and Habit Magic?
hints: PULL THE RABBIT OUT OF THE HAT

child.title: Bonfire Riddle
hints: The riddle book is useful here.

child.title: The Icicle
hints: It is now a well-boiled icicle.

child.title: Elf and Smock
hints: MAKE SMALL TALK WITH THE ELF
There's a lot of you in the elf.

child.title: The Jeans
hints: Jack never climbed a jean stalk.

child.title: Squealing Mare
hints: A mare squeal is low in nutrition.
You've met the face of hunger.
GIVE THE SQUARE MEAL TO THE GIRL

child.title: The Crow
hints: A blushing crow never hurt anyone.

child.title: On Cloud 673
hints: Think of the top of your head.
First, wear the hat on the way up.
TAKE OFF THE HAT. GIVE IT TO GIANT
Now make a heavy of the giant.

child.title: Descend a Cloud
hints: The beets problem is a sleeper.
You can tie and still be a winner.

child.title: Giant Defeat
hints: It'd be a crushing defeat, too.
TAKE THE BLOW. HIT GIANT WITH IT

child.title: Return the Pearl
hints: Also, MAKE SMALL TALK WITH ELF
UNLOCK DOOR WITH THE SHINY KEY

child.title: The Horn
hints: POSSESSION IS NINE TENTHS OF THE LAW
Or, TAKE POSSESSION OF THE HORN
When he's here, TOOT YOUR OWN HORN

child.title: Laurel Bush
hints: You might BEAT AROUND THE BUSH
TAKE A LAUREL BRANCH, and only...

child.title: Piece of Cake
hints: Life's a bowl of cherries when...
You read through all the hints.

child.title: A Blessing
hints: Now you can take it into the house.

child.title: Six Pack
hints: TAKE THE BEER UNDER FALSE PRETENSES

child.title: The Duck
hints: It's a politician whose time is up.
Refer to it as a LAME DUCK

child.title: A Jar
hints: When is a jar not a jar?
Refer to it as A DOOR

child.title: The Comb
hints: It's fine teeth won't miss a thing.

child.title: Skeleton
hints: Rid the Mayor of it for good.
FIVE THE SKELETON THE DEEP SIX

child.title: Dirty Linen
hints: WASH THE DIRTY LINEN IN PUBLIC

child.title: Bathing Mayor
hints: THROW THE BABY OUT WITH THE BATHWATER

child.title: Mother
hints: Decree after you've won his respect...
GIVE THE DECREE TO THE MAYOR
